result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th) and Operating w/ PAC (8th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (8th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John W. Krings was found guilty of OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in Full - Cash Bonds previously posted as to Waushara Co Case Nos. 2014CF000186 and 2015CF000043 have been applied.  The remaining balance of the cash bond in the amount of $1500.00 has been turned over to WISCTF for application to the current support as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2008FA000044.
DNA Surcharge paid in full from cash bonds previously posted.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 14CF-186, 15CF-43 and 15TR-413 - Both Cases Called @ 10:15 AM: Defendant John W. Krings in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Minimum mandatory sentence explained with duration.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Agrees with 7 priors as recited by Court.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (OWI 8):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Count 2 dismissed outright.  15CF-43 and 15TR-413 both DRI.  Counsel confirm Joint recommendation on sentencing.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Category of offense nullifies Def's opportunity to enroll in TAD Court.  Imposes 7 yr bifurcated term of imprisonment  - 3 yrs IC/4 yrs ES. 6 days of credit against SEH.  Conditions of ES: Ab Sob; Bar Prohibition; Not to possess/ingest any impairing substance unless prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  $3500 Fine inclusive of Costs - bond from each case to be applied to financial obligations DNA surcharge to be attached - 60 DTP or PP - Bonds posted should cover entirely; 36 mos DL Rev/IID for 36 mos; OWI Assessment prior to any relicensing.  Eligible for SAP/Aged Ineligible for CIP.  Appeal Rights Given.  Def is immediately eligible for SAP to the extent available thru DOC.  Def requests that any add'l bond be turned over for CSUP.  $3500 posted to be applied first and then any balance that Def posted ($1500) and then be turned over for CSUP.   Bond revoked - Def remanded into custody.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-15-2015 10:00 am
Exhibit No. 1 - 4 Photographs
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Case Called @ 10:10 AM: Defendant John W. Krings in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  4th Amendment Motion as to lawfulness of stop - counsel agree.  Dep Scott Eagan sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA Blader.  Record to reflect positive ID of Defendant by witness.  Ex No 1 marked - Series of 4 Photographs.  DA moves for admission of Ex No 1 - entered and received.  Cross-Exam by Atty Everson.  No Argument offered by Atty Everson.  Based upon off record discussion - offense date confirmed of 11/5/14. The Court:  Will make a determination based upon today's record.  Finds record establishes clear cut and convincing case for lawful investigative detention - 2 violations of traffic code had transpired. 4th Amendment motion challenging legality of stop is dismissed.  Off Record for counsel to confer w/Defendant.  Back of Record @ 10:52 AM:  Per Atty Everson - requests P/S date.  No PSI will be requested by either counsel.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Defendant reminded that bond continues during pendency.  Should any motion be filed regarding child support issues, Court will try and accommodate dual scheduling.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: 11:21 am case called. Defendant John W. Krings in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested and waiver of time limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing. PH- Scheduled - NOH Given. Statement by Attorney Everson regarding conflict with Waushara County District Attorney. Attorney Everson states his client will waive any potential conflict with the District Attorney's prosecuting this matter. Court accepts waiver of any potential conflict.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on November 12, 2014 at 11:15 am.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and may not be present upon the premises of any bars.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:11 p.m. Defendant John W. Krings in court with attorney Kirk William Everson. Attorney Everson appears telephonically. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by Atty Everson. DA Blader requesting $3500 Cash Bond. Atty Everson requesting a signature bond. Court orders $3500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 11:15 am.
